channel.title: facebook on Internet Freedom Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in facebook on Internet Freedom Foundation

item.title: Your mom was right: Facebook is bad for you!
item.description: In light of the recent whistleblower revelations against Facebook, which allege that Facebook is well aware of the harms it causes but chooses to prioritise profit, we wrote to the Parliamentary Standing Committee on IT asking them to initiate an inquiry.

item.title: Social media giants have released their Compliance Reports for the month of August. We’ve analysed them.
item.description: Google (including YouTube), Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Twitter have released their reports in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d) of the IT Rules 2021 for the month of August.

item.title: Facebook exposé signals the need for India to update its social media regulations
item.description: In light of the recent facebook disclosures, we wrote to MEITY about any forthcoming updates to the Information Technology Act, 2000. We pointed out several inadequacies and lacunae in the Act, and asked the Ministry to publish a full consultation timeline over any proposed amendments.

item.title: Social media giants have released the second round of 'Compliance Reports'. We’ve analysed the data.
item.description: We analyse the transparency reports submitted by Google, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Twitter in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d) of the Information Technology (Guidelines for Intermediaries and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021.

item.title: Big Tech releases its transparency reports in compliance with the IT Rules: Here’s what we found
item.description: Google, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Twitter have released their transparency reports in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d) of the Information Technology (Guidelines for Intermediaries and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021 (the 2021 IT Rules).

item.title: Was your handle blocked without warning? Here’s what you can do.
item.description: Incidents of arbitrary censorship of online speech have significantly risen in the recent past. We are frequently asked what can be done if one’s account is blocked. We have prepared a step by step explainer to navigate situations of arbitrary account blockings.

item.title: Examining Facebook’s Human Rights Policy
item.description: We analyse Facebook’s recently announced Human Rights Policy. It is too little, too late, and we call on it to improve its practices openly and transparently for Indian users of its platforms.
